TopicTitle: Bill, Bob, and Jeb are officially sadist.

Articles.Content:
So... I decided to copy the part folder for the stack decoupler, and increase its\' ejection force to 3500. It was designed to be a very crude 'bullet' of sorts. I then placed a rocket on the launch pad, and drove a small vehicle with the 'bullet' mounted on it. When I fired the bullet at the rocket, the rocket completely exploded, killing the Kerbals inside. When I looked at my crews\' faces... they were ALL smiling.

KSP may be for kids (by this I mean it\'s not bloody or vulgar), but the devs did not make them very caring of what happens to their companions.

You mean massochist. Misread the OP

Also, KSP is not for kids. At least, not exclusively.

You mean massochist.

No, Massochist means they want to hurt themselves.
How far back was your rover launched when you shot the bullet?
Because the explosions were far enough away that they won\'t panic.

No, Massochist means they want to hurt themselves.

I misread the OP, and thought they were smiling amid their own destruction. My mistake.

I\'m sorry, but I just have to correct y\'all -- it\'s 'Masochist'. Two s\'s, not three. Anyway, that aside...

I\'ve noticed my crew smiling during a Mun landing... when I landed on top of a crewed lander already on the surface... and burnt the crew in there alive.

They are indeed sadist.

The way I see it, Bill and Bob joined the KSP without knowing who their third partner and captain of the crew would be, and realised they signed up for their deaths.

For Jebediah Kerman, is a living psychopath with a rocket.

Kerbals like fireworks. If they\'re not a part of them, that is.

They will usually smile when they see/hear an explosion in the distance.

Cheers

Kerbals like fireworks. If they\'re not a part of them, that is.

They will usually smile when they see/hear an explosion in the distance.

lol that is awesome.
Wait... they\'re actually coded to smile if they see/hear an explosion? Haha, nice
I would just like to mark it down for the record is that it is written nowhere that KSP is for kids. It is for everyone, kids and adults included.

I would just like to mark it down for the record is that it is written nowhere that KSP is for kids. It is for everyone, kids and adults included.

Yes I know it\'s not specifically marketed for kids, but it sure isn\'t T or M rated.

Kerbals like fireworks. If they\'re not a part of them, that is.

They will usually smile when they see/hear an explosion in the distance.

Cheers

They bones are made of C4, aren\'t they?
yep it is on evas you zoom in AND its freaky once i was doing eva i had my jetpack i was on kerbland so i was flying and hit my kerbs body on a piece of derbis and it died like -snaps- that fast

yep it is on evas you zoom in AND its freaky once i was doing eva i had my jetpack i was on kerbland so i was flying and hit my kerbs body on a piece of derbis and it died like -snaps- that fast

Do not necro posts.
I think somebody forgot to tell them that the rocket was manned. They loved watching the firework from a safe distance, they didn't know about the people in it...
